Ingredients.2: 1 tablespoon seasoned salt, or to taste

Ingredients.4: 0.75 cup barbecue sauce, or to taste

Directions.1: Remove silver skin from the underside of rib tips if there. Rub seasoned salt all over meat.

Directions.2: Line a baking pan with aluminum foil; place seasoned meat into the pan. Cover tightly with another piece of foil and refrigerate for at least 4 hours to overnight.

Directions.3: Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C).

Directions.4: Bake foil-wrapped ribs in the preheated oven for 2 1/2 hours.

Directions.5: Remove the pan from the oven and increase oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Directions.6: Uncover and drain the pan, if necessary. Brush barbecue sauce over ribs.

Directions.7: Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.

Directions.8: Flip ribs and brush with additional barbecue sauce; continue baking for another 15 minutes. Repeat this step two more times.

Directions.9: Cut ribs into desired serving size, about 1 1/2 to 2 inches.

Directions.10: Turn on the oven broiler. Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source.

Directions.11: Broil ribs until slightly charred, 2 to 3 minutes. Watch carefully to make sure they do not burn.
